title: Tsitsipas Faces Career Doubts Amid Back Injury Recovery
summary: Stefanos Tsitsipas, a Greek tennis player formerly ranked as high as world number three, revealed that he considered retirement during the 2025 season due to severe back pain. The injury, which plagued him for six to eight months, caused significant concern, especially after his US Open loss to Daniel Altmaier left him unable to walk for two days. Currently ranked 36th with limited play since August, Tsitsipas has seen progress through medical treatment and completed a pain-free five-week off-season training block. He expressed excitement about testing his back in actual matches and aims to compete without pain in the upcoming United Cup and Australian Open. Tsitsipas emphasized his goal for 2026 is to finish matches without worry, highlighting his belief in a comeback through hard work and ongoing care. This story underscores the physical and mental challenges athletes face with injuries.
